items.title: New England Says Goodbye to Coal as Merrimack Station Powers Down
items.description: The towering smokestacks of New England’s last coal-fired power plant have gone quiet. Merrimack Station in Bow, New Hampshire, shut down in September, years ahead of its scheduled closure, marking the end of coal-fired energy production in the region.
